summary: This is a cover email from an Assistant United States Attorney to Judge Nathan's chambers, submitting a joint letter from the parties in United States v. Maxwell (20 Cr. 330) that provides a list of names and places for voir dire. It indicates procedural coordination between prosecution and defense ahead of jury selection.

persons.name: Nathan
persons.context: The email is addressed to Judge Nathan's chambers, indicating she is the presiding judge in United States v. Maxwell.

persons.name: Maxwell
persons.context: The case is United States v. Maxwell, indicating Ghislaine Maxwell is the defendant.

connections.description: Judge Nathan is presiding over the criminal case against Maxwell.

events.title: Submission of joint letter for voir dire
events.description: The parties (prosecution and defense) submitted a joint letter providing a list of names and places to be used during jury selection (voir dire).

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The document is a procedural filing in the criminal case United States v. Maxwell (20 Cr. 330).
The parties jointly submitted a list of names and places for voir dire, indicating coordination between prosecution and defense on jury selection issues.
The filing was submitted to Judge Nathan's chambers by an Assistant United States Attorney.
The attached letter (2021-11-14joint_letter regarding_names_and_places.pdf) contains the specific list, but its contents are not detailed in this cover email.
